message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses a method for deep reinforcement learning that involves selecting a subset of input variables to be memorized by the agent's internal memory. This method is designed to improve performance in situations where the agent only has partial observations of the environment. This topic is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Given the focus on deep reinforcement learning and the use of neural networks, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. However, the discussion of robotics and control suggests that cs.RO and cs.SY are also relevant, while the potential applications in computer vision suggest cs.CV as a possible sub-category.
